justification: The data clump with key 0 has a significant number of common fields between two classes (Stats and BrokerStatsManager). Since it includes 25 common string constants that likely represent configuration or metric keys, this indicates that these two classes are managing shared concepts that could be tied to a single responsibility or domain entity. Refactoring this data clump could greatly reduce the duplication of these constants and centralize their management, making the codebase cleaner and more maintainable. Common constants like these spread across classes can lead to harder-to-manage code and higher risk of errors when updating these values or adding new ones.
